____ is the distribution of the initial cost by periodic changes to operation as in depreciation or the reduction of a debt by either periodic or irregular prearranged program.

During the 1989 “military exercise”, an F 16 jet fighter on “persuasion flight” while horizontally flying at.a low altitude of 1 kilometer above the ground slows down at 720 km/hour and drops a bomb on the suspected lair of rebel soldiers. Determine the acute angle (in degrees) between the vertical and the line joining the aircraft and target at the instant when the bomb was released at Libis, Quezon City.

A 20 kilogram mortar projectile has a velocity of 600 meters per second. The shell acquired the velocity in a mortar barrel 3 meters long. The average force against the shell as it was fired was ____ KiloNewtons.

An aluminum cube, 10 centimeters on a side, is subjected to a shearing force of (10) 6 Newtons. The top of the cube is displaced 0.03 centimeters with respect to the bottom. Its shear modulus is ____ Gigapascals.

In measuring pressure, 1 millimeter of mercury is equivalent to a unit called __

A 60 gram bullet moving with a speed of 500 meters per second strikes a 5 kilogram block moving in the same direction with a speed of 30 meters per second. The resultant speed of the bullet and the block is ____ meters/second, assuming the bullet to be embedded in the block.

A ball rebounds vertically from a horizontal floor to a height of 20 meters. On the next rebound, it reaches a height of 14 meters. The coefficient of restitution between the ball and the floor was___

When stress equals strain, the body is ______.
The point which indicates the sales volume at which the enterprise will be able to pay these dividend is ______________.
It is the amount which a willing buyer will pay to a willing seller for the property when neither  one is tinder compulsion to buy or to sell.
It is the value assigned to the property for the purpose of establishing rates.
A flat circular coil with 100 turns has a radius of 5 centimeters. If an 4 ampere current is made to pass at the center of the coil, the magnetic field developed at the center is ____ Tesla.

Jennifer Bulak. while playing “jackstone”, MOCK BOARD EXAMINATION IN GENERAL ENGINEERING AND APPLIED SCIENCES (D) June 9, 2009 accidentally drops the rubber ball from a window about 63 centimeters high. Each time the ball hits the flat ground, it rebounds to two thirds (2/3) of the previous height from which it fell. The total distance traveled by the ball before coming to rest is ____ centimeters.
A pound of force is equivalent to _____ Newtons.

The vector operator on a vector function that, for a three dimensional function, is equal to the sum of the vector cross product of the unit vectors and partial derivatives in each of the component directions.
In nuclear physics, a / an ______ is a particle of antimatter corresponding to a given particle in every respect except that charge and certain other discrete properties change sign.
____ is a particle that exhibits a strong nuclear force.

Don Fausto wants to make 14% nominal interest compounded semi annually on   a bond investment. How much should he be willing to pay now for 12%, P 10,000 bond that will mature in ten (10) years and pays interest semi annually?

In mathematical logic, there are three traditional laws of thought to exemplify something fundamental on the way, we think. If we say that something cannot be TRUE and FALSE all at the same time, this law is called the Law of ____________.

Felicito draws three balls in succession (without replacement), from a box containing five (5) Red Balls, Six (6) Yellow Balls, Seven (7) Green Balls. The probability of drawing the balls in the order Red, Yellow and Green is _____

A family of curves whose equations are the solutions of a given differential equation, i.e. the family of circles: x 2 + y 2 = c 2 , which is the solution of the differential equation x + y (dy / dx) = 0.
Find a, b, c which satisfies the hypothesis of Rolle’s theorem for f(x) = x 2 3 1.

A rectangle is inscribed in a square so that each vertex of the rectangle is at the trisection point of different sides of the square. The ratio of the area of the rectangle to that of the square is ___.
An integer greater than one that has no integral factors except itself and one is called ___ number.
Find a number “c” which satisfies the conclusion of the “Mean Value Theorem” for f(x) = 1/x, a=2 and b = 4.
A steel ball at 120°C cools in 20 minutes to 80°C in a room at 25°C. Find the temperature of the of the ball after half an hour.
A man is three times as old as his son. Five years ago. He was five times old as his son was at that time. How old is the son.
Two years ago, a boy is 2/3 as old as his sister. In two years, the boy will be ¾ as old as she. How old are they?
options: The boy is 10 yrs. old and his sister is 14 years old.
The sister of the boy is older than him.
The boy is 13 yrs. old and his sister is 14 yrs. old.

MATHEMATICS.question: Mary is twice as old as Ana was when Mary was as old as Ana is now. How old is Ana?

The sum of the parents’ ages is twice the sum of their children’s ages. Five years ago, the sum of the parents’ ages is four times the sum their children’s ages. In 15 years, the sum of the parents’ ages will be equal to the sum of their children’s ages. How many children are there?
A and B can do a piece of work in 20 days, B and C in 30 days, C & A in 40 days. How long can each worker do the work alone?
Ding can finish a job in 8 hours. Tito can do it in 5 hrs. If Ding worked ahead for 3 hours and then Tito was asked to help him finish it, how long will Tito have to work with Ding?

A pipe can fill up the tank with the drain open in 3 hrs. If the pipe runs with the drain open for 1 hr. and then the drain is closed, it will take 45 more minutes for the pipe to fill up the tank. If the drain will be closed right at the start of filling, how long will the pipe be able to fill up the tank?
How much tin and how much lead can be added to 700 kg of an alloy containing 50% tin and 25% lead to make an alloy which is 60% tin and 20% lead?
options: Add 175 kg of lead and no lead.
Add 170 kg of tin with lead
Add 175 kg of lead and tin
Add 175 kg of tin and no lead

MATHEMATICS.question: A man bought 20 pcs of assorted calculators for P20, 000. These calculators are three types, namely:
options: Household type at P500/pc. How many of each type did he buy?
3 pcs programmable type; 4 pcs scientific type; 10 pcs household type

MATHEMATICS.question: Find the smallest number which when: you divide by 2, the remainder is 1; you divide by 3, the remainder is 2; you divide by 4, the remainder is 3; you divide by 5, the remainder is 4; and when you divide by 6, the remainder is 5.

An equilateral triangle with inscribed circle is drawn inside a circle whose radius is 2m. Another equilateral triangle with inscribed circle is drawn inside the smaller circle, and so on and so forth. Find the sum of perimeters of all triangles drawn.

Four grapefruits (considered spheres) 6cm in diameter were placed in a square box whose inside base dimensions are 12cm by 12 cm. In the space between the first four grapefruit, a fifth of the same diameter was then placed on top of them. How deep must the box be so that the top will just touch the fifth grapefruit?

A spherical ball of radius 3 cm was drooped into a conical vessel of depth 8 cm and radius of base 6 cm. what is the area of the portion of the sphere which lies above the circle of contact with the cone?
Find the volume of the solid common to two cylinders intersecting at 90 0 angle if radius of cylinders are both 3m.
Find the volume of a right conoid whose radius of base is 1m and every cross section is an isosceles of altitude 2m.
Find the location of the center of the circle defined by the equation, X 2 + y 2 + 4x – 6y – 12 = 0

A car headlight reflector is cut by a plane along its axis. The section is a parabola having the light center at the focus. If the distance of focus from vertex is ¾ cm, and if the diameter of reflector is 10cm, find its depth.
Find the equation of an ellipse with axis parallel to X@axis, center at (0, 0), eccentricity is 1/3, and distance between foci is 2.
Find the equation of the locus of a point that moves so that difference of its distance form points (@4, 0) and (4, 0) is 6.

The altitude and radius of a cone were measured and found to be 2m and 1m respectively. If the maximum possible errors in measurement are 3cm and 2cm respectively, find the maximum possible error in calculating the volume.
A 6 ft. tall man walks away from a 20 ft. high lamppost at the rate of 3 ft/sec. Find:
options: How fast is the tip of his shadow moving?
How fast is the length of his shadow changing?
